TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit VisualsToXpsDocument extends System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator

Docs.summary: Provides methods for writing objects to XML Paper Specification (XPS) documents or to a print queue in batch mode.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Because this class has no constructor, use the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.CreateVisualsCollator%2A> method to create an instance.
The <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument> writes to the same target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> as the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> that creates the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument>.
Each <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual> becomes a page in the document.
## Examples The following example shows how to create a visuals collator and use it to write to an [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_metro](~/includes/tlasharptla-metro-md.md)] document.
[!code-csharp[XpsSave#CreateAndWriteToVisualsCollator](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsSave/CSharp/XpsSaveHelper.cs#createandwritetovisualscollator)] [!code-vb[XpsSave#CreateAndWriteToVisualsCollator](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsSave/visualbasic/xpssavehelper.vb#createandwritetovisualscollator)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override void BeginBatchWrite ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void BeginBatchWrite() cil managed

Docs.summary: Indicates that write operations can begin.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You must call this method before you call any <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument.Write%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument.WriteAsync%2A> methods.
After the last write operation, call <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument.EndBatchWrite%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void Cancel ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Cancel() cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, an exception is thrown if the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument.Cancel%2A> method is called and a writing operation is not in progress.

Docs.exception: The state of the is not compatible with a operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void CancelAsync ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void CancelAsync() cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, an exception is thrown if the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument.CancelAsync%2A> method is called and a writing operation is not in progress.

Docs.exception: The state of the is not compatible with a operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void EndBatchWrite ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void EndBatchWrite() cil managed

Docs.summary: Indicates that write operations must end.

remarks.format:
## Remarks After the last call to <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument.Write%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument.WriteAsync%2A>, call this method.
You must call <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument.BeginBatchWrite%2A> before any write operations.

.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Write(class System.Windows.Media.Visual visual) cil managed

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use this method to write to an [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_metro](~/includes/tlasharptla-metro-md.md)] document.
[!code-csharp[XpsSave#CreateAndWriteToVisualsCollator](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsSave/CSharp/XpsSaveHelper.cs#createandwritetovisualscollator)] [!code-vb[XpsSave#CreateAndWriteToVisualsCollator](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsSave/visualbasic/xpssavehelper.vb#createandwritetovisualscollator)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override void Write (System.Windows.Media.Visual visual, System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Write(class System.Windows.Media.Visual visual, class System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket) cil managed

Docs.param: A that represents the default printing preferences for the document.
Docs.summary: Writes a synchronously to an or a and includes a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>. If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.

An object that contains the data that the caller wants to pass to the event handler.
Docs.summary: Writes a asynchronously to an or a ; also includes a and any additional information that the caller wants to pass to an event handler.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>. If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
